post_content:
The Senior Copywriter will create copy for print and digital advertising, to video, social media properties or a combination of all three complimenting the art direction. They'll be an integral part of our creative department, working closely with our creative and strategy teams. This role brings big idea thinking and a highly skilled craft of words with flexibility in writing styles for multiple clients, in varying mediums. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
  • Copywriting, independently as well as in teams with art director and copywriter partners on print, TV, OOH, traditional and non-traditional platforms
  • Coordinate with agency studio, production managers, and broadcast production department to create mechanicals and presentation materials
  • Meet, and help the team to meet, internal and external deadlines on all projects for which you are responsible for:
  • Conceptual, interactive assignments
  • Commitment and follow through on jobs
  • Timely turnaround on assignment
  • Conceptual, interactive assignments
  • Update maintain all copy decks and scripts through production and beyond
  • Maintain and accurately complete timesheets by required deadlines
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor’s Degree and or Portfolio School Training
  • 5+ years of copywriting experience
  • Extensive television, digital, radio, and print production experience
  • Ability and experience presenting to clients
  • Strong leadership skills and ability to direct junior team members as well as ability to effectively communicate with senior leads from multiple departments.
  • Ability to work effectively with team members across various departments and with partner agencies and vendors
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Experience in creative storytelling
  • Strong ideation skills
  • Able to write in a variety of voices
  • Ability to provide insightful and creative interpretation
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Able to take direction
  • Ability to direct talent
  • Able to multitask and work on multiple projects simultaneously with multiple project leads
  • Builds strong relationships at appropriate client/vendor levels
  • Intermediate to advance experience using Mac-based applications including MS Word,
  • PowerPoint and Keynote
  • Possess and demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity and resourcefulness
  • Collaborative team player who shares ideas for the greater good
Burrell is an equal opportunity employer M/F/D/V

About Us Daigle Creative services small businesses and large nonprofits, Fortune 500 companies, and large government/education organizations. Clients choose us for our track record, talent, innovation, and energy. They stay with us because we respect their budgets, their deadlines, their time, and most importantly because we provide them with dynamic, creative solutions that work. About The Opportunity We are hiring a Senior Graphic Designer. The ideal candidate for this full-time, salaried, hybrid position will have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work that demonstrates their passion for illustrative design and typography. The candidate will have experience in working with numerous different design platforms such as digital and print forms. Responsibilities include collaborating with the agency team to ensure consistency of designs across various media outlets, creating compelling and effective logos, designs, print and digital media, and maintaining awareness of current industry and technology standards, social media, competitive landscape, and market trends. Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or related field
  • 5+ years of experience in graphic design
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite
  • HTML and/or WordPress experience preferred but not necessary
  • Strong communication, conceptual thinking, typography skills, and design skills
  • Strong portfolio of work
Benefits
  • Includes salary, paid vacation, healthcare, disability, 401K

ABOUT  Weber Shandwick is seeking a dynamic and motivated digital/social Art Director to join our growing Content community. We are looking for someone with the right combination of social platform knowledge, conceptual approach, self-motivation, and artistic skills necessary to create, sell and execute impactful social content for our clients. You will be creating videos, social content, activations and experiences for our clients. A passion for type and design, the ability to visually convey your ideas through beautiful comps, and an appreciation for brand consistency must be in your DNA. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY
  • Craft stories and build brands through social-first thinking and execution
  • Develop original concepts with the intention of sparking conversation and engagement in social media
  • Collaborate with copywriters, producers, creative directors and other team members to flesh out the creative development of your executions
  • Proactively bring new ideas, creative concepts and design solutions to client work
  • Create production-ready designs and layouts, establishing the look/tone/feel for campaigns and executions, and convey ideas through well-designed presentations
  • Translate video story ideas into visual sequences through storyboards, mood boards, etc.
  • Ensure all visual design adheres to existing brand guidelines
BASIC REQUIREMENTS
  • Minimum of 2+ years of art direction and/or design experience in a related agency or department (advertising, digital, social media, publishing/content or public relations)
  • Ability to work quickly, efficiently, and accurately within all required aspects of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator) as well as presentation software such as Keynote and PowerPoint
  • Ongoing drive to understand emerging techniques, trends and philosophies in design, technology, interaction and social media
  • Work well across various teams and talent communities
  • Basic or advanced knowledge in AfterEffects is preferred but not mandatory
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
  • Strong decision-making skills
  • Aptitude for being well organized
  • Strong presentation skills, poise and professionalism
  • Ability to multi-task and perform in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
  • Resourceful, entrepreneurial and inclusive
Weber Shandwick is proud to The Weber Shandwick Collective recognizes that your health and wellbeing are a priority. This is why we offer a full suite of benefits including:
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401k (with employer match)
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Juice Money – $60 monthly reimbursement to be used towards purchases that nourish your health, mind, body, and soul
  • MyDays – Flexible holiday schedules
  • Short-Term Disability
  • Paid Employee Family Leave
  • Family Building Benefit
Weber Shandwick is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Weber Shandwick recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status. We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

post_content:
As a Senior Copywriter, you are a seasoned storyteller who loves to collaborate with creatives and strategists to bring a digital voice to life. Grasping communication challenges and devising imaginative solutions that are both brilliant and on-brand is what you do. You also know the ins and outs of site copy, banner ads, direct e-mails, interactive scripts, and other online marketing. To demonstrate high-quality, insightful approaches with outstanding results, you pull from a wide variety of experiences on past projects. Copy is your comfort-zone, but you’ve got a well-rounded knowledge of the broader industry—social media, usability, online marketing, and traditional advertising. You’re also a dynamic leader who can champion a creative direction with clients and be an inspiring mentor to junior copy staff. YOU WILL 
  • Lead concept development.
  • Partner with designers, art directors, and creative directors to bring concepts to life.
  • Work closely with art directors and designers to ensure copy tone and style are consistent with visual tone and style.
  • Participate in strategic brainstorming, campaign development, creative brief development, and creative execution.
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously. Interact with project teams to understand business objectives and audience demographics.
  • Translate creative direction and copy points from creative briefs into engaging and effective copy concepts.
  • Maintain high standards of copywriting and exercise quality control.
  YOU HAVE
  • 3-5+ years’ experience as a copywriter in an agency environment—including experience with interactive media and direct marketing.
  • Exceptional writing skills, including the ability to write in a range of voices and styles for varied projects with diverse audiences.
  • Proven aptitude for quick, creative thinking with acute attention to detail within demanding deadlines.
  • A keen enthusiasm for and demonstrable understanding of Web trends and technologies.
  • A strong understanding of marketing (especially direct marketing) and advertising principles.
  • Experience with brainstorming, campaign development, creative brief development, and creative execution.
  • The ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and effectively juggle diverse writing demand and in-store experiences.
  THE ASK STEMS FROM OUR WANT TO The Talent Team at Critical Mass is focused on ensuring we provide the best training,mentorship, and employee experience possible. CM new hires & employees are the future of our organization, and we want to set you up for long-term success. Inaneffort to do so, weexpect our teamto work from an office a minimum of4days a week.
  • Strengthen opportunity for continuous learning
  • Improve collaboration and teamrelationships.
  • Increase employee engagement
We understand that not everyone may feel comfortable with this expectation, so we ask that you please let us know immediately if there are any concerns so we can help navigate accordingly. Critical Mass is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We do not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you are an individual with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@criticalmass.com . We are committed to fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion within our pool of candidates, with a target of achieving at least 50% representation from underrepresented communities. The Critical Mass Talent Acquisition team will only communicate from email addresses that use the URLs criticalmass.comand us.greenhouse-mail.io . We will not use apps such as Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, or Google Hangouts for communicating with you. We will never ask you to send us money, technology, or anything else to work for our company. If you believe you are the victim of a scam, please review your local government consumer protections guidance and reach out to them directly. On-site in Birmingham, MI ABOUT The first job of a copywriter is to have ideas, to see the world in a new way, and to share that unique vision with consumers in a way that they immediately understand. We expect that this Senior Copywriter will provide inspiration and leadership for their entire Creative Department, and be the trusted consultant on any matters of language arising in the Agency. This role requires the ability to devise original, strategically sound and persuasive copy that is in line with client-approved direction, working with art resources where appropriate. RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Attends briefing sessions and discuss Brand, Selling Strategy and purpose of the brief with the appropriate members of the brand/project management teams
  • Reviews incoming job starts, creative briefs and other forms of project initiation to make sure the team has all the right information and sufficient time (whenever possible) required for the creative team to deliver the best creative solution possible for each client assignment
  • Where necessary, challenges preconceptions and propose alternative approaches or solutions where these will more effectively achieve the objectives identified in the brief
  • Works with an Art Director, the Creative Director (or alone, if necessary) to create appropriate concepts
  • On approval of concept by account team and client, prepares full copy Takes responsibility for initial spell checking and then amendments to own copy in light of clients’ comments
  • Provides writing support and expertise on a wide variety of media
  • Write-ups of creative concepts for presentation to clients and internal teams
  • Creates a team environment that facilitates: Development of strategic and conceptual thinking, mutual respect and teamwork partnership among creative team members and throughout the Agency functions and maintains open lines of communication with all team members
  • Understands the roles and responsibilities of other Agency teams (including Strategic Planning, Digital and Account Management) and manages their involvement appropriately
  • Ensures professional presentation of concepts
  • Maintains effective communication with all relevant internal and external contacts
  • Keep abreast of both competitor creative work and market developments in areas of interest to client accounts
  • Expresses thorough understanding of clients business as well as their competitor’s
  • Solicits “the right information” upfront translating to a better product the first time
  • Provides pertinent information to team members on a timely basis
  • Manage own time and output in line with deadline and budgetary requirements of the job
  • Where appropriate work with other Agency departments to identify potential award winning campaigns with the aim of winning awards
  • Submit a daily Time Sheet detailing work execution
  • Develop and cultivate relationships with internal team members, vendors and clients
  • Proven ability to ‘sell’ creative concepts to client and Agency staff
  • Valuable contributor to client team
  • Can think and act strategically
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
  • 3-5+ years of experience within digital marketing or a comparable industry
  • Portfolio is required to demonstrate creative skills
  • Demonstrated judgment and imagination for the creation of an advertisement
  • Experience with online content (websites, email, banner ads, etc)
  • Experience with print pieces is a plus
  • Experience in emerging platforms (mobile, tablets, etc) is a plus
  • Motivated, self-starter with an action oriented and can-do attitude
  • Capable of juggling multiple projects, sticking to deadlines and ensuring high-quality error-free output

Bakery is looking for a highly skilled and experienced social content creator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating high-impact content that engages and connects with audiences on social media. The Content Creator is a creative and strategic thinker who is passionate about creating engaging and impactful social content. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute social media campaigns that drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversion. You will also be responsible for managing social media channels, monitoring performance, and reporting on results. ABOUT US Bakery is an independent creative and culture agency designed to ignite people's obsession in great products. From our headquarters in Austin, TX, we work with highly ambitious brands like Johnnie Walker, Nike, Shiner Beer and DeLorean Motors to infuse cultural value and drive desire at every interaction, increasing their fame and helping them make things people want. Bakery is a 2022 AdAge Small Agency of the Year. RESPONSIBILITIES 
  • Along with a team of Digital Marketing Managers and Social Media Specialists, develop and execute creative social media campaigns that align with business goals
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including creative, production, and social strategy
  • Design market-ready graphics, which can involve generating still photography and video
  • Help come up with big and small ideas that make the difference between good and great work
  • Work with the team to take advantage of real-time culturally relevant moments and work them into meaningful content
  • Scope project timelines accurately and ensure impeccable and timely launch of content across all campaign channels.
  • Expertly present and explain concepts
  • Address internal and client feedback
  REQUIREMENTS
  • 3+ years of hands-on creation of engaging content (graphics, video, photo) for social media and other platforms
  • A stunning portfolio showing professional, proven and strategic experience in graphic design, still photography, retouching, cinematography, set design/ art direction, and post-production
  • Expert knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, and After Effects
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced setting under tight deadlines
  • Grasp of current digital advertising best practices and proven experience creating for social media and online platforms, including; Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and Web
  • Detail-oriented mindset; productive without compromising quality
  BENEFITS
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Unlimited Vacation Time
  • 2 weeks Work From Anywhere (WFA)
  • Annual Retreats
  • Pet-Friendly Office
  • Yearly Creative Stipend
  • Summer Movies @ Alamo Drafthouse
  • Snacks, Meals and Drinks
  • No Time Tracking!

About: We’re as insightful and conceptual as ever—constantly innovating and finding new ways for brands to bring their story to life. And we’re doing it with more and more ease. Our ability to interpret feedback is stronger, and we’re mastering the art direction craft with our own distinct visual voice. While we’re still a major force of idea generation, our creative directors are beginning to entrust us with responsibilities beyond brainstorms, creative decks and art direction alone. We’re leaning even more into the production of our ideas: key visuals, social media production, storyboard video concepts, mockups, storytelling presentations and connecting the dots between mediums in 360 campaigns. Our specialty: We roll up our sleeves to get to the idea—then tinker and toil 'til it’s just right. Job Specific Responsibilities:
  • Be yourself.
  • Maintains high quality on creative deliverables.
  • Supports larger creative team in brainstorming sessions and concept creation
  • Assists in asset creation and delivers work they’re proud of
  • Has a strong strategic sense and can concept against a creative brief
  • Stays current on latest industry trends
  • Assists creative lead in research and presentation materials.
  • Presents work internally and is occasionally introduces to present to the client.
Management/Leadership Responsibilities:
  • Completes self-reviews
  • Inputs time consistently
  • Participates and helps plan community-building events
  • Receptive to constructive criticism
  • Is proactive in finding ways to support the creative team
  • Finds moments to mentor junior art directors
  • Be cool
Experience:
  • 4 – 6 years art directing for an advertising, design studio or marketing agency
  • Exceptional portfolio that includes strong art direction and conceptual thinking.
  • Strong command of standard design and layout applications.
  • Strong awareness and understanding of the digital landscape, including online campaigns, mobile experiences, and social media landscape.
  • Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Sketch, Google Docs
Education: Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Fine Arts, Graphic Design, Digital Media Design, or Advertising/Portfolio school

post_content: Who we are: At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience. We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. Who we are looking for: Wunderman Thompson is seeking a brilliant Creative Director, Art to join our world class creative team.  You should be able to work independently as well as collaboratively – owning a project without any handholding needed. Excellent client and presentation skills expected. You should be able to work and lead, owning an array of client projects. Excellent client relationship and presentation skills are expected. We’re looking for someone who can do the job, and then surprise us with something we’ve never thought of. A one-two punch of confidence and inspiration. Someone who possesses a talent for transforming great ideas into award-winning creative and has a passion for visual storytelling. We are looking for a Creative leader who enjoys selling their ideas as much as they love crafting them. A note about workstyle: Wunderman Thompson would like candidates for this position to be comfortable going into our New York office 2 days a week at a regular cadence of Wednesday & Thursday. What you’ll do:  Concept and collaborate on campaign ideas and digital tactics with a creative team while working on multiple projects. Oversee the translation of the client’s vision into a roadmap that guides our agency, not only to achieve client goals, but also to generate work that is creatively brilliant, measurable, and culturally impactful Craft original concepts, execute art based on established voice/tone, and collaborate with mid- and junior-level creatives to execution.. Partner with the Group Creative Director to concept, create, present, and defend work while addressing client needs. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams across the agency to ensure timely deliverables. Anticipate team and client needs, project risks, and participate in driving resolution. Inspire clients and co-workers through good work, good spirit, and excellent communication. What you’ll need: A minimum of 9 years of experience in creative direction, preferably in advertising or a related industry. Portfolio with successfully launched client projects on broadcast work, social, and everything in between. Outstanding portfolio showcasing digital and social platforms with strong conceptual thinking. Solid understanding of creative development—from drafting briefs to executing deliverables. Well-versed in scriptwriting and in crafting both short and long-form content. Ability to direct and mentor junior team members. Ability to handle a high-volume environment with rapid turnaround times and manage multiple tasks and project details. Practiced time management skills and a strong work ethic. What we offer:  Passionate, driven people | We champion a culture of people that do extraordinary work. Consciously cultivated culture | We aim to embody the behaviors to build an inclusive community that is in it together, bringing both positivity and active listening into the workplace as we simultaneously strive to empower creative bravery. Competitive benefits | What we offer full time hires ranges from the full spectrum of group health coverage options (medical, dental, vision) to a generous 401k match (100% dollar-for-dollar match, up to 5% of salary contribution), and a variety of paid time off offerings that reflect our investment in all aspects of your overall life balance and wellness. Growth-minded opportunities | We aim to nurture a culture of real-time feedback, growth-oriented mindset, and plenty of training opportunities through Wunderman Thompson and WPP, so you can continue to grow personally and professionally. Wunderman Thompson is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability, or other protected group status. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit a diverse slate of candidates to help us achieve that goal. The base salary range for this position at the time of this posting is indicated below. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including location, business needs, level of responsibility, experience, and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, click WPP Benefits for more details. At Wunderman Thompson, we are committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect.  As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve. Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency.

Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience. We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. Who we are looking for: Wunderman Thompson Atlanta is seeking an Associate Director of Design to break things. To set trends. To go beyond the expected. To elevate brand ideas and executions. To grow our own and our client’s expectations of what great design truly is. We’re looking for an ACD of Design to become our design visionary with the experience, skills, and desire to be our lead on all things design–from traditional advertising media to emerging technology and experiences that blur the lines of advertising, content, and products. You will be responsible for leading our design practice and working with a portfolio of local, national, and global clients across a variety of industries to deliver thoughtful design experiences that inspire audiences while solving complex business. This position is hybrid-flexible, with candidates ideally located in Atlanta, GA or surrounding areas. Candidates may work remotely as needed, with our spectacular new office at The Fourth Ward, 505 N Angier Avenue NE, recently opened and available for use! What you’ll do: Design | This is a hands-on leadership position. As a design lead, we expect you to take the lead design role on key projects as well as delegating and managing the full design team. Mentor | Provide mentorship and support for a team of 4-5+ designers. Direct and inspire teams to create outstanding and cohesive design work across the client portfolio. Partner with Clients | You’ll serve as a trusted creative advisor to all levels of clients, leading them and earning their trust by demonstrating credibility in your craft, an unbiased perspective and unique take on their business challenges, a passion for their brand and their customer, and an unwavering focus on their success. Innovate | Exemplify fearlessness in the face of the undefined and a passion for bringing order through design exploration. Concept and collaborate on campaign ideas and experiences with Creative Directors while working on multiple projects. Collaborate | You’ll serve as a subject-matter expert in all things design and help lead clients, team members and peers to think about opportunities that solve business challenges, while meeting brand and customer needs. You’ll work closely with our Creative Directors, as well as a multi-disciplinary group of Strategists, Project Managers, and Account Teams. Create | We take great pride in delivering work that goes beyond the brief. You will report to our Executive Creative Director and be regularly brought into concept for a wide range of projects from brand campaigns to emerging tech experiences. Who you are: A Detail-Obsessed Design Expert | You know all aspects of design and take great pride in the details and craft of delivering truly great design. Endlessly Curious | You’re passionate about visual storytelling and delivering experiences that are more than just answering a client’s problems, and are innately curious about human motivations and needs. You enjoy following the solution through all stages of the process so that the integrity, consistency, and fidelity of the experience is delivered with a high-level of craft. Influencer & Communicator | You know how to educate, persuade, and drive projects, inspiring both clients and junior members of the design team. You have a demonstrated ability to synthesize and present your work to client and internal audiences of all backgrounds. You have excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills required to make the complex feel and sound simple and compelling. What you’ll need: 5-7+ years of experience in an agency or design studio, with a minimum of 3 years of client-facing experience. Experience managing direct reports required. Portfolio featuring a wide range of award-worthy creative work that displays mastery of your craft. Expertise in the formal elements of visual design, including typography, color, layout, balance, proportion, rhythm, emphasis, and unity. Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud, MS Office, and Keynote. Sketch and SketchUp experience are a bonus. Proven design-led conceptual and campaign experience; demonstrated success working on integrated campaigns that include digital, social, and/or emerging media. Experience managing and directing large-scale productions covering a range of mediums throughout the production process. Experience working across multiple parallel work streams and within an agile environment. What we offer:   Passionate, driven people | We champion a culture of people that do extraordinary work. Consciously cultivated culture | We aim to embody the behaviors to build an inclusive community that is in it together, bringing both positivity and active listening into the workplace as we simultaneously strive to empower creative bravery. Competitive benefits | What we offer full time hires ranges from the full spectrum of group health coverage options (medical, dental, vision) to a generous 401k match (100% dollar-for-dollar match, up to 5% of salary contribution), and a variety of paid time off offerings that reflect our investment in all aspects of your overall life balance and wellness. Growth-minded opportunities | We aim to nurture a culture of real-time feedback, growth-oriented mindset, and plenty of training opportunities through Wunderman Thompson and WPP, so you can continue to grow personally and professionally. At Wunderman Thompson, we are committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect.  As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve. Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency.

About the Agency: David&Goliath is an agency that adheres to one simple philosophy: Brave. To be brave, to inspire people and brands to take on their goliaths. To create lasting impact that the world can feel and truly embrace. This is our purpose and for over two decades, we have never wavered from it. We are not made for everyone. We are made for the few who believe that purpose isn't just a business proposition, but a way of life. And for those who believe we can achieve the unthinkable, together. David&Goliath is a collaborative, empathetic, and team-oriented culture that believes in taking on challenges that others might walk away from. Because, the truth is, nobody ever became great without first being brave.   About the Role: We are seeking a Copywriter who is able to develop creative concepts and execute those across all mediums including broadcast, print, and all forms of digital and social content. You are a team player and able to collaborate with Art Directors and other creative team members. You stay up to date with technology and trends. Above all you want to create great work, win awards and make our clients proud.   Qualifications:
  • A very strong portfolio showing a full and diverse range of work in URL form
  • A demonstrated ability to conceptualize and write campaigns for television, print, online and social media marketing against defined strategic platforms.
  • A passion for advertising
  • Possess highly developed communication and presentation skills
  • Have a solid understanding of broadcast and digital production processes
Application: Video Link (1 min. max); show us why you're brave! We're not looking for the highest quality editing, just good content. The role is based in Los Angeles, CA.

Snapshot of what we’re looking for Looking to do purpose-driven work for some of the biggest CPG brands in the world? Like to guide concepting and ideation? How about shaping the narrative for client presentations? Can you get into the details and lead the team to success? Are you highly organized, keeping teams on track? If so, this could be a great role for you. Our ACD-Copywriter works in partnership with an ACD-Art Director, both reporting into a CD on the Unilever team. As an ACD, you’ll have direct reports (typically 1-3 team members) and take the lead on a variety of projects. Ideally, this candidate will be an ACD already, or have 3-5+ years as a Senior Copywriter. This is a working role where you’ll have the opportunity to lead and be an individual contributor on the work itself, about 80/20. The Unilever team As the largest team at Arc, the Unilever team is high-volume and high-profile. We won 5 Reggie Awards and 6 Effie Awards based on our first year of work with the client. Sure, a high volume of the work consists of turnkey commerce executions, but there are huge creative opportunities as well. Our creative work consists of retailer-specific activations for accounts like Walmart, Target and Kroger as well as national shopper activations for brands like Dove, Degree, Knorr and Dollar Shave Club. Qualifications Short-list of what you’ll do
  • Conceive and execute creative to deliver on the agreed upon strategy
  • Manage a team of approximately 1-4 creatives
  • Elevate work through mentorship, critique, and hands-on contributions
  • Guide decks into strong presentation narratives
  • Lead development of direct reports through mentorship, coaching and ongoing performance feedback
  • Collaborate with other departments for the success of the work and business
  • Partner with CDs and SVP/CD to foster ongoing team health and creativity
The must haves
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Collaborative spirit
  • Strong portfolio, shopper or commerce work preferred
  • Top-notch communication skills
  • Command of writing mechanics
  • Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferred
  • Don’t take yourself too seriously
Additional Information The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:
  • Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
  • Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
  • Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
  • Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
  • Tuition Assistance
  • Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
  • Matching Gifts programs
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • ‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
  • Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances
  The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.   Arc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color,ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.   All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

About the job We have a simple belief — Unexpected Works. It means that the best idea is the one you never saw coming. The thing that catches you so off guard that you can‘t look away. And the only path to genuinely unexpected works is through creativity. Not just what passes for creativity because it answers a brief, looks the part and helps everyone sleep at night. But creativity that is foreign, surprising and interesting enough to cause jaws to drop and sales to soar. It’s having the fresh perspective and raw energy to bring something into the world that no one’s ever seen before. We’re talking about the courage to shake things up and maybe even tear a few things down. And knowing that what most would call the finish line is where the real work starts. We believe in people, product, and profit, in that order. For us, people always come first. They’re the soul of our agency. It takes amazing folks to make amazing work. That’s why we make sure everyone who comes through the door is as great as the people who are already here. It’s also why we constantly strive to build diverse teams where everyone brings something unique to the table. Because you can’t make the unexpected if you only work with the usual suspects. By bringing together diverse thinkers with different backgrounds and perspectives, we validate Bill Bernbach’s notion that an idea can turn to dust or magic, depending on the talent that rubs against it. So, come be part of the magic. Art directors oversee the artistic design of advertisements and print materials, as well as the filming of television commercials. They are the decision makers who are responsible for the quality of the finished product. The art director chooses a photographer, an illustrator, models, and any props necessary for an ad. If a print ad comes back from the printer with an imperfection, the art director is responsible for retouching it. Responsibilities
  • Responsible for not only the "look" of an ad but is also part of a creative team responsible for developing the very concept. An art director and a copywriter (who writes the ads) may decide on an advertising concept together. Then they determine how the ad will look and what it will say.
  • To create a "print" ad—one that appears in a magazine or a newspaper or on a billboard—the art director creates a rough layout using a computer. The layout shows where the copy will go, which fonts and colors will be used, and what the picture will look like. At this stage, the layout must be approved by the client. Once a rough layout for an ad is approved, the art director uses all the resources of the agency to produce the finished ad.
  • Work begins in a large, open work area known as the bull pen, where the art director supervises a team of artists who work up the rough layout of an ad, refine it, and put it together on the computer. Assistants scale photographs and illustrations to the proper size and decide on the typeface. They run the copy and the photographs through the computer programs to create the pages as they will appear in print.
  • The client's first look at a television ad is in the form of a storyboard—a kind of comic-strip version of the action and dialogue of the ad. The art director draws the storyboard as a model for the filmed ad. Many people help prepare an ad for television. The art director and the copywriter then join forces with a producer, who handles the budget and the technical details. All three choose a director to film or tape the ad. The art director also helps to cast the actors for a television advertisement—they must have the "look" the art director wants.
Qualifications
  • A portfolio containing a collection of best work
  • Training in graphic design, including courses in typography, design, layout, and photography.
  • Ability to work under constant pressure as there are always deadlines to meet, layouts to deliver to the printer, or commercials that must be taped as soon as possible. (Delays in the production of a television commercial can be very expensive, and the art director is ultimately responsible for having everything ready on time and staying until the shooting is finished.)
  • Expertise in Photoshop and Illustrator is essential.
  • Proficiency in Flash and Dreamweaver is strongly desired .

The office is located in Plano, Texas. Hybrid schedule. About Us Cheil Worldwide is the 10th-largest creative agency in the world. Headquartered in Seoul, South Korea, we were founded by Samsung in 1973 to grow its local and global business. While Samsung is still one of our main clients, our roster has evolved to include other globally recognized brands such as Adidas, Coca-Cola, ESPN, Lego, Nivea, PayPal, Starbucks, and many more. Cheil Dallas serves as the lead agency for all Samsung projects in North America and is located steps from their office at Legacy Central in Plano, Texas. It’s the home base for more than 200 creative problem-solvers who share a passion for developing groundbreaking ideas rooted in data, driven by insights, and enabled by innovative technology. And that brings us to you… or rather you to us. Pushing boundaries and traditional advertising requires a curious mind undeterred by the never-been-done. We need a thinker and doer eager to explore new ways to connect with consumers beyond offering a product. If blending analytics with intuition and imagination makes your eyes sparkle, read on! About You Who you are is just as important as (if not more important than!) what you can do.
  • You’re a creator to your core. Making things is what makes you happy.
  • You possess an insatiable curiosity about the world, spanning emerging technology, art, literature, music, gaming, sports, and more.
  • You have a keen eye for visual design, with a deep understanding of how to create engaging content for the digital experience.
  • You possess a genuine passion for work – yours or anyone else’s – that elicits a visceral reaction.
  • You have a portfolio of work that showcases your ability to create innovative and impactful designs.
  • You value strategy and know that strong concepts require a solid foundation to succeed. Understanding the “why” is just as important as the “what.”
  • You believe in working collaboratively with other creatives and disciplines, prioritizing a team-first mentality.
  • You are proactive in seeking help and solutions, while being resourceful in finding answers on your own.
  • You are adaptable and able to work on multiple aspects of a project simultaneously.
  • You can connect the dots between a powerful idea, how it’s visually executed, and the impact that has on its performance.
  • You’re adept at recognizing excellent ideas and executions that will help brands break through the clutter.
  • You excel in a fast-paced and high-pressure work environment, tackling challenges with a positive and solution-oriented approach.
  • You don’t have an ego. You have big ideas without having a big head. Yeah, it’s a thing.
  • You bring a sense of fun and good vibes to work every day, while remaining driven to exceed your own best.
  About The Role Like you, this job is multidimensional. And every aspect is crucial to creating culturally relevant work.
  • Concept and design digital innovation for e-commerce sites, software interfaces, mobile apps and more.
  • Design with mobile-specific design considerations in mind, such as touch interfaces, mobile navigation, and device-specific resolutions, as well as best practices for responsive design, cross-browser compatibility, and search engine optimization (SEO).
  • Work in an agile development environment, collaborating with developers and other stakeholders to iterate and refine designs based on user feedback and changing project requirements.
  • Collaborate closely with your Team Lead, Creative Director, other art directors and copywriters, as well as account, development, and product teams to create cohesive and successful award-winning ideas and work that exceed client expectations.
  • Participate and provide value. To brainstorms. To the work. To Cheil.
  • Deliver ideas that are strategically sound and directly hit the insight.
  • Balance primary project responsibilities with the flexibility to shift focus to secondary projects if needed.
  • Maintain brand integrity by obsessing over company and client style guides, and upholding them consistently.
  • Effectively communicate ideas through presentations that sell and inspire, while being receptive to feedback and edits.
  • Ensure creative quality and consistency across the board while keeping the big picture in mind.
  • Continuously learn from every project, utilizing insights and results to elevate future work.
  • Contribute to an open, honest, and supportive team environment where everyone feels valued and heard.
  • Lead by example and set the standard for creative excellence in the art direction discipline.
  • Create emotionally engaging content that resonates with audiences and drives action, leveraging insights and data to optimize output.
  • Manage and mentor junior and mid-level members to support their development.
  About The Requirements You’ve got to check the boxes before you can think outside of them.
  • Bachelor’s degree in creative, design-related fields preferred.
  • 6+ years of agency and/or in-house creative experience, with a proven track record of delivering exceptional work.
  • Advanced knowledge across a range of software, including Adobe
  • Excellent time management, organizational and communication skills.
  • Strong conceptual skills, with an online portfolio of smart and exciting work that showcases your range and ability to deliver against business objectives.
  • Passionate, positive, and solution-oriented, with the ability to work collaboratively and creatively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Able to work on-site in a hybrid work environment 3 days per week at the Plano, Texas location.

What You’ll Do

• Working on designs to produce an effective advertising campaign
• Working from a brief with a copywriter, generating ideas to present to the client
• Good client presentation skills demonstrating a clear vision of how the work addresses the client challenge
• Collaborates with account planner to develop creative ideas for integrated campaigns
• Layout for digital and web campaigns and social media
• Adapts visual style to brand tonality
• A strong eye for typography and layout
• Curious and knowledgeable of latest design trends
• Takes constructive feedback well
• Responsible for consistency of look across media from original concept through final release.
• Translate strategic direction (as outlined in a Creative Brief) into powerful advertising communications.
• Work as a team with Copywriter.
• Take creative direction and turn work around quickly to meet deadlines.
• Contribute to the new business activities of the agency
• Strong conceptual abilities, enjoys brainstorming, solid art direction skills and a knowledge of the digital landscape
• Talent to inspire clients and team members with great visual design
• Desire to take on new challenges, grow and learn every day
• Creates Illustrations for advertising campaigns
• Design of mass communications for online distribution
• Editing adaptations for commercials
• Photography and videography direction and execution

What You’ll Need
• 3+ years experience in an advertising setting
• A bachelor’s degree, graphic and web design
• Must have strong conceptual ability.
• Must have strong Art Direction abilities across advertising disciplines.
• Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
• Previous experience in QSR/foodservice industry a plus
• Familiarity with designing for Latin American and Caribbean audiences a plus
• Bilingual preferred (English and Spanish)
• Strong production skills: is comfortable preparing files for press and releasing artwork to vendors.

And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.

Hybrid New York Who we are looking for: Wunderman Thompson is seeking a brilliant Creative Director, Copy to join our world class creative team. A conceptual thinker who can write manifestos, long form, and headlines. You should be able to work independently as well as collaboratively – owning a project without any handholding needed. Excellent client and presentation skills expected. You should be able to work and lead, owning an array of client projects. Excellent client relationship and presentation skills are expected.   We’re looking for someone who can do the job, and then surprise us with something we’ve never thought of. A one-two punch of confidence and inspiration. Someone who possesses a talent for transforming great ideas into award-winning creative and has a passion for visual storytelling. We are looking for a Creative leader who enjoys selling their ideas as much as they love crafting them.   What you’ll do:
  • Proficiently write in diverse copy styles across a range of assignments.
  • Concept and collaborate on campaign ideas and digital tactics with a creative team while working on multiple projects.
  • Oversee the translation of the client’s vision into a roadmap that guides our agency, not only to achieve client goals, but also to generate work that is creatively brilliant, measurable, and culturally impactful
  • Craft original concepts, execute copy based on established voice/tone, and collaborate with mid- and junior-level writers on copy execution..
  • Partner with the Group Creative Director to concept, write, present, and defend work while addressing client needs.
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams across the agency to ensure timely deliverables.
  • Anticipate team and client needs, project risks, and participate in driving resolution.
  • Inspire clients and co-workers through good work, good spirit, and excellent communication.
  What you’ll need:
  • A minimum of 9 years of experience in creative direction, preferably in advertising or a related industry.
  • Portfolio with successfully launched client projects on broadcast work, social, and everything in between.
  • Outstanding portfolio showcasing digital and social platforms with strong conceptual thinking.
  • Solid understanding of creative development—from drafting briefs to executing deliverables.
  • Well-versed in scriptwriting and in crafting both short and long-form content.
  • Ability to direct and mentor junior team members.
  • Ability to handle a high-volume environment with rapid turnaround times and manage multiple tasks and project details.
  • Practiced time management skills and a strong work ethic.
  What we offer:
  • Passionate, driven people | We champion a culture of people that do extraordinary work.
  • Consciously cultivated culture | We aim to embody the behaviors to build an inclusive community that is in it together, bringing both positivity and active listening into the workplace as we simultaneously strive to empower creative bravery.
  • Competitive benefits | What we offer full time hires ranges from the full spectrum of group health coverage options (medical, dental, vision) to a generous 401k match (100% dollar-for-dollar match, up to 5% of salary contribution), and a variety of paid time off offerings that reflect our investment in all aspects of your overall life balance and wellness.
  • Growth-minded opportunities | We aim to nurture a culture of real-time feedback, growth-oriented mindset, and plenty of training opportunities through Wunderman Thompson and WPP, so you can continue to grow personally and professionally.
Wunderman Thompson is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability, or other protected group status. (Hybrid Role) Austin, Texas Who we are: At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience. We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. Who is Wunderman Thompson MAP? Wunderman Thompson MAP is the world-leading center of excellence for Marketing Automation, Personalization, Loyalty and CRM at scale. Our mission is to deliver value for our clients by humanizing the relationship between the brand and the consumer. To do this, we help clients make data-driven and personalized experiences that can be scaled with efficiency and operationalized intelligently. We believe that serving consumers personal, mindful content in an omnichannel world is key to transforming experiences. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. At Wunderman Thompson MAP, we are always making room for more. We are 800+ technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 40+ nationalities who collaborate closely to help our clients inspire and engage consumers on five continents. The role: Can you see yourself creating original copy for some of the most ambitious brands in the world? Do you instinctively know how to take the shortest path to the point in your writing? Are you a hungry, ambitious communicator with CRM experience and a voracious love of the written word? If so, you may be the Copywriter or Senior Copywriter we’re seeking! NOTE: We are seeking talent with ad agency experience local to Austin, TX and are open to considering paid relocation to Austin for qualified candidates in the U.S. who would bring solid CRM experience. What will your day look like? We’re looking for someone with top-notch writing skills and ad agency experience to join us full-time as a Copywriter or Senior Copywriter in our first ever location in North America. As our new team member, you will write communications for multiple global clients, gaining a thorough insight into their businesses. Your primary job will be to create compelling copy for Loyalty, CRM, and other comms channels. You will:
  • Write original copy for emails, push notifications, and paid media, including eye-catching subject lines and pre-headers.
  • Brainstorm communication and copy ideas with the team.
  • Revise copy based on internal and client feedback.
  • Edit new business & pitch decks from our Consultancy and Growth teams.
  • Play an active role in projects, from initial idea generation to execution and approval – closely liaising with CRM comms/content strategists on assignments.
  • Study insights or reports to give your copy a strong conceptual foundation.
  • Research topics as needed to develop a deep understanding of our client's business.
  • Lean on brand playbooks and tone of voice guides to create copy aligned with clients’ brand values.
  Who will you work with? As a member of the Experience Communications & Design team, our Copywriter/Senior Copywriter will write and edit content for a variety of CRM-focused projects (e.g., email programs with dynamic and static copy) working closely with communication strategists, CX/UX designers, data scientists, tech developers and project managers to brainstorm ideas and articulate messaging. You will interact with interesting and kind colleagues in a setting that prioritizes collaboration and camaraderie. We come from diverse backgrounds and have unique skill-sets, so you’ll get plenty of opportunities to apply your expertise. An important part of being an employee in Wunderman Thompson MAP is also to be a culture bearer and someone who enjoys being surrounded by amazing colleagues. While we do have flexibility as needed to allow for working from home, we are building a team that can work on-site (in either Austin, TX or Toronto, Canada) most of your time. This is particularly of value to us in the first 3-6 months of your employment, as we will be flying in team members from MAP in Copenhagen to help establish our first presence in the U.S./North America. This means you will be a vital piece of our new office! What do you bring to the table? You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with a high-volume workload often requiring short turnaround times. Your conscientious and solution-oriented mindset enables you to digest complex information and translate strategy and insights into persuasive copy. You value flawlessness and careful editing, ensuring all deliveries are spotless and effective. Required skills and qualifications:5+ years of copywriting experience from an advertising agency or in-house agency Please NOTE: Agency experience is a firm requirement. Candidates without ad agency experience will not be considered. Experience with personalization and automation as it pertains to CRM / loyalty marketing Excellent communication skills and flawless writing talent A relevant background in journalism, English, communications, or related discipline Ability to work independently or with a team to meet deadlines   What to expect of the recruitment process? You will meet different people from the Experience Design & Communications teams throughout the interview process. Before the second round, we ask candidates to complete a short writing assignment, done at home at your convenience. Growth-minded opportunities | We aim to nurture a culture of real-time feedback, growth-oriented mindset, and plenty of training opportunities through Wunderman Thompson and WPP, so you can continue to grow personally and professionally.   Wunderman Thompson is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability, or other protected group status. Snapshot of what we’re looking for Looking to do super cool work? Like to run brainstorm meetings? How about shaping the narrative for client presentations? Can you get into the details and lead the team to success? Are you highly organized, keeping teams on track? If so, this could be a great role for you. Our ACD of Copy works in partnership with an ACD of Art, both reporting into a CD on the team. As an ACD, you’ll have direct reports (typically 1-3 team members) and take lead on a variety of projects. Ideally, this candidate will be an ACD already, or have 3-5+ years as a Senior Copywriter. This is a working role where you’ll have the opportunity to lead and be an individual contributor on the work itself, about 50/50. The Molson Coors team As one of the larger clients at Arc, the Molson Coors team is alive with activity, highly collaborative and ripe with opportunities. Sure, some of the work is nitty gritty, but we’re constantly doing fun work that can give you (and your portfolio) a buzz. As Molson Coors’ commerce partner, our ideas are showing up everywhere beer is sold. Grocery and convenience stores, restaurants, pubs, sporting events (hello football lovers!), concerts and more. We’re continuously working on national creative, local activations and projects to support our sport team alliances. Some of the brands we work with include Miller Lite, Coors Light, Miller High Life, Blue Moon, Peroni, Sol, Keystone Light, Vizzy and a handful more. Short-list of what you’ll do
  • Conceive and execute creative to deliver on the agreed upon strategy
  • Manage a team of approximately 1-3 creatives
  • Elevate work through mentorship, critique, and hands-on contributions
  • Guide decks into strong presentation narratives
  • Collaborate with other departments for the success of the work and business
  • Partner with CDs and SVP/CD to foster ongoing team health and creativity
Qualifications The must haves
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A collaborative spirit
  • A strong portfolio, shopper or commerce work preferred
  • Top-notch communication skills
  • Command of writing mechanics
  • Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferred
Additional Information The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:
  • Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
  • Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
  • Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
  • Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
  • Tuition Assistance
  • Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days,
  • Holiday and Identity days, and more
  • Matching Gifts programs
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • ‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
  • Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances
The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents. Arc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color,ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our office is in Plano, Texas  About Us Cheil Worldwide is the 10th-largest creative agency in the world. Headquartered in Seoul, South Korea, we were founded by Samsung in 1973 to grow its local and global business. While Samsung is still one of our main clients, our roster has evolved to include other globally recognized brands such as Adidas, Coca-Cola, ESPN, Lego, Nivea, PayPal, Starbucks, and many more. Cheil Dallas serves as the lead agency for all Samsung projects in North America and is located steps from their office at Legacy Central in Plano, Texas. It’s the home base for more than 200 creative problem-solvers who share a passion for developing groundbreaking ideas rooted in data, driven by insights, and enabled by innovative technology. And that brings us to you… or rather you to us. Pushing boundaries and traditional advertising requires a curious mind undeterred by the never-been-done. We need a thinker and doer eager to explore new ways to connect with consumers beyond offering a product. If blending analytics with intuition and imagination makes your eyes sparkle, read on! About You Who you are is just as important as (if not more important than!) what you can do.
  • Your curiosity is insatiable. You seek knowledge about the world, technology, art, literature, music, gaming, sports, and everything in between.
  • You are a culture connoisseur, both mainstream and niche, because you know that understanding the world is essential for disrupting it.
  • You are enamored with words and writing, and you may have even hugged a sentence before.
  • You have a diverse skillset and are comfortable working on a variety of projects including but not limited to retail, web copy, experiential, pitch work, social media, video scripts, and long-form content, with a mind for high level concepts.
  • Your keen attention to detail enables you to craft language that is clear and concise, while possessing an excellent grasp of grammar and punctuation.
  • You possess a genuine passion for work – yours or anyone else’s – that elicits a visceral reaction.
  • You love strategy and know strong concepts need a solid foundation to stand on. Without the why, there is no what.
  • You emphasize a team-first mentality and recognize the value of collaborating with other creatives and other disciplines.
  • You are not afraid to ask questions or seek assistance, but you are resourceful enough to try to figure it out on your own.
  • You never sacrifice clarity for cleverness, but you are always searching for that sweet spot.
  • You are adaptable and capable of handling separate aspects of projects, and multiple projects, simultaneously while delivering excellent, well-written concepts, both on time and in the appropriate format.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight timelines and varying levels of pressure.
  • You are a positive, solution-oriented individual who brings good vibes and a sense of fun to work every day, all while being driven to exceed your own best.
  About The Role Like you, this job is multidimensional. And every aspect is crucial to creating culturally relevant work.
  • Develop and implement messaging strategies that align with brand voice and tone for both external clients and our internal company, while considering other integrated campaigns.
  • Balance primary project responsibilities with the flexibility to pivot to secondary projects as necessary.
  • Collaborate closely with your Team Lead, Creative Director, other copywriters, and art directors to create cohesive and successful award-winning ideas and work that exceeds client expectations.
  • Communicate ideas effectively through presentations that persuade and inspire, while also being receptive to feedback and edits.
  • Embrace progress over perfection by regularly sharing work with your manager for feedback.
  • Continuously learn from every project, leveraging insights and results to enhance future work.
  • Adapt to shift across various projects with agility.
  • Contribute to an inclusive, transparent, and supportive team environment where everyone feels valued and heard.
  • Create emotionally engaging content that resonates with audiences and drives action, leveraging insights and data to optimize output.
  • Be open to a variety of project types and styles – anything from retail and UX, video concepts and VO scripts, pitch work, experiential, and in-store signage.
  About The Requirements You’ve got to check the boxes before you can think outside of them.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in communications, journalism, or a related field preferred.
  • 4-6 years of agency and/or in-house creative experience, with a proven track record of delivering exceptional work across a range of channels and platforms.
  • Experience working on social, gaming, emerging tech, retail, experiential, and/or pitch work is ideal, with a focus on delivering work that is equally creative and strategic.
  • Strong conceptual chops with an online portfolio of smart and exciting work that showcases your range and ability to deliver against business objectives.
  • Passionate, positive, and solution-oriented, with the ability to work collaboratively and creatively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Able to work in a hybrid office environment – 3 days minimum in the office, with the other days optional remote.
  • Open to travel, extended hours, and weekend work as necessary.

About The Role Like you, this job is multidimensional. And every aspect is crucial to creating culturally relevant work. We are seeking a talented Senior Motion Designer with 2D and 3D experience and management skills to join our team. The Senior Motion Designer will be responsible for leading the motion design team and managing projects from concept to final delivery. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creativity, a strong portfolio of work, and a proven track record of successful project management.
  • Lead the motion design team, providing direction and guidance on projects and ensuring that all work meets the highest standards of quality.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, from concept to final delivery, ensuring that all deliverables are completed on time and within budget.
  • Manage the animation pipeline, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation, and ensure that all work is delivered on time and within budget.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, animators, and producers, to develop creative concepts and visual solutions.
  • Create and execute compelling 2D and 3D animations, graphics, and visual effects for a variety of mediums, including broadcast, social media, and digital.
  • Animate characters, props, and backgrounds, ensuring that movements are smooth, realistic, and in line with the style and tone of the project.
  • Understanding of animation principles, including timing, pacing, and character movement.
  • Work with the Creative Director to establish best practices and standards for motion design, and implement new processes and workflows as needed.
  • Stay up-to-date on industry trends, technologies, and best practices, and share knowledge with the team.
  • Manage and mentor junior motion designers, providing feedback and guidance on their work and helping them develop their skills.
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, vendors, and other stakeholders.
  • Attend client meetings and presentations as needed, and present work to clients when necessary.
  About The Requirements You’ve got to check the boxes before you can think outside of them.
  • Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, motion design, or a related field preferred.
  • 4+ years of experience in motion design, with a strong portfolio of work showcasing 2D and 3D animations, graphics, and visual effects.
  • Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Blender, and other relevant software.
  • Strong understanding of design principles, including composition, color theory, and typography.
  • Attention to detail, with the ability to create precise, accurate animations.
  • Proven track record of successful project management, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver on time and within budget.
  • Excellent leadership and management skills, with experience managing and mentoring a team of designers and animators.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate ideas and present work to clients and stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of video production, including shooting, editing, and post-production, is a plus.
  • Understanding of social media platforms and digital marketing is a plus.

Headquartered in Seoul, South Korea, we were founded by Samsung in 1973 to grow its local and global business. While Samsung is still one of our main clients, our roster has evolved to include other globally recognized brands such as Adidas, Coca-Cola, ESPN, Lego, Nivea, PayPal, Starbucks, and many more. Cheil Dallas serves as the lead agency for all Samsung projects in North America and is located steps from their office at Legacy Central in Plano, Texas. It’s the home base for more than 200 creative problem-solvers who share a passion for developing groundbreaking ideas rooted in data, driven by insights, and enabled by innovative technology. And that brings us to you… or rather you to us. Pushing boundaries and traditional advertising requires a curious mind undeterred by the never-been-done. About the job

We have a simple belief — Unexpected Works. It means that the best idea is the one you never saw coming. The thing that catches you so off guard that you can‘t look away. And the only path to genuinely unexpected works is through creativity. Not just what passes for creativity because it answers a brief, looks the part and helps everyone sleep at night. But creativity that is foreign, surprising and interesting enough to cause jaws to drop and sales to soar. It’s having the fresh perspective and raw energy to bring something into the world that no one’s ever seen before. We’re talking about the courage to shake things up and maybe even tear a few things down. And knowing that what most would call the finish line is where the real work starts. We believe in people, product, and profit, in that order. For us, people always come first. They’re the soul of our agency. It takes amazing folks to make amazing work. That’s why we make sure everyone who comes through the door is as great as the people who are already here. It’s also why we constantly strive to build diverse teams where everyone brings something unique to the table. Because you can’t make the unexpected if you only work with the usual suspects. By bringing together diverse thinkers with different backgrounds and perspectives, we validate Bill Bernbach’s notion that an idea can turn to dust or magic, depending on the talent that rubs against it. So, come be part of the magic.

Art directors oversee the artistic design of advertisements and print materials, as well as the filming of television commercials. They are the decision makers who are responsible for the quality of the finished product. The art director chooses a photographer, an illustrator, models, and any props necessary for an ad. If a print ad comes back from the printer with an imperfection, the art director is responsible for retouching it.

Responsibilities

• Responsible for not only the "look" of an ad but is also part of a creative team responsible for developing the very concept. An art director and a copywriter (who writes the ads) may decide on an advertising concept together. Then they determine how the ad will look and what it will say.
• To create a "print" ad—one that appears in a magazine or a newspaper or on a billboard—the art director creates a rough layout using a computer. The layout shows where the copy will go, which fonts and colors will be used, and what the picture will look like. At this stage, the layout must be approved by the client. Once a rough layout for an ad is approved, the art director uses all the resources of the agency to produce the finished ad.
• Work begins in a large, open work area known as the bull pen, where the art director supervises a team of artists who work up the rough layout of an ad, refine it, and put it together on the computer. Assistants scale photographs and illustrations to the proper size and decide on the typeface. They run the copy and the photographs through the computer programs to create the pages as they will appear in print.
• The client's first look at a television ad is in the form of a storyboard—a kind of comic-strip version of the action and dialogue of the ad. The art director draws the storyboard as a model for the filmed ad. Many people help prepare an ad for television. The art director and the copywriter then join forces with a producer, who handles the budget and the technical details. All three choose a director to film or tape the ad. The art director also helps to cast the actors for a television advertisement—they must have the "look" the art director wants.

Qualifications

• A portfolio containing a collection of best work
• Training in graphic design, including courses in typography, design, layout, and photography.
• Ability to work under constant pressure as there are always deadlines to meet, layouts to deliver to the printer, or commercials that must be taped as soon as possible. (Delays in the production of a television commercial can be very expensive, and the art director is ultimately responsible for having everything ready on time and staying until the shooting is finished.)
• Expertise in Photoshop and Illustrator is essential.
• Proficiency in Flash and Dreamweaver is strongly desired .

DDB is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and to review all of our job postings to minimize biased language. DDB Chicago does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state or federal law.
